title: General
description: Establishes general food safety requirements for farm operations including responsible personnel, organic certification documentation, and comprehensive hygiene and health rules

requirements.text: Is there a trained on-site person responsible for the operation's food safety program?
mandatoryStatements: On-site person is designated as responsible for food safety program
Responsible person has received food safety training
Training documentation is maintained
Person has authority to make food safety decisions
Contact information for responsible person is documented
Backup personnel are identified for absences
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of training currency and competency
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly review of food safety program oversight activities

requirements.text: If the operation is growing under organic principles, is there written documentation of current certification by an accredited organic certification organization?
mandatoryStatements: Current organic certification certificate is maintained (if applicable)
Certification is from an accredited organic certification organization
Certification scope covers the audited operation
Certification is valid and not expired
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of organic certification renewal
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Review certification status before expiration date

requirements.text: Does the operation have written food safety hygiene and health rules covering at least worker and visitor hygiene and health, infants and toddlers, animal presence in growing and storage areas, fecal matter, dropped product, blood and bodily fluids?
mandatoryStatements: Written food safety hygiene and health rules are documented
Rules address worker hygiene and health requirements
Rules address visitor hygiene and health requirements
Rules prohibit or control infants and toddlers in production areas
Rules address animal presence in growing and storage areas
Rules address handling of fecal matter contamination
Rules address handling of dropped product
Rules address handling of blood and bodily fluids
Rules are communicated to all workers and visitors
Rules are posted in appropriate locations
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of hygiene rules for completeness, verification through observations during audits
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily supervision of hygiene rule compliance, immediate correction of violations

capaInject: If no trained person responsible: designate responsible person immediately, provide training within 30 days
If organic certification expired: immediately cease organic claims, obtain renewal or discontinue organic operations
If hygiene rules incomplete or not followed: update rules immediately, retrain all personnel within 7 days, implement enhanced monitoring
traceabilityInject: Training records for responsible person must be traceable to specific training dates and training providers
Organic certification documentation must be traceable to certification body and certification dates
Hygiene rule training records must be traceable to specific employees and training dates
